summary.p: 5 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 52; Qurʾānic Text: Q 38:72-38:88, Q 39:2-39:3; 5 lines per page; Dimensions: 252/254 x 177mm; Script style: kūfī D.III.
The fragments Marcel 51, Marcel 102/2 (NLR) and probably Marcel 48, Arabe 357 (BNF), Ms. orient. A 435 and A 461 (Gotha) belong to the same manuscript.

This entry was created on the basis of the information made available by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014), without use of manuscript images. Therefore, the exact distribution of the Qurʾānic passages across the manuscript pages is unknown to us, and all the passages are shown as belonging to fol. 1. The catalogue entry by Polosin contains the following information:
5 fol. 177×252/254 mm (1.42/1.44). Support: thin rigid transparent parchment of yellowish color, with traces of polishing. Writing material: black ink.
Collation: fragment of one quire, fol. 1 and 5, 3 and 4 are bifolia, fol. 2 is a singleton with a stub. The missing sheet from the quire (between fol. 4 and 5) is now attached to Marcel 102 (fol. 4).
I: H1F H2F H3F / F4H S F5H.

Text layout: 84×158 mm (1.875), 5 lines. Ruling: absent. Script: D III. Diacritics: green diagonal dashes; omitted alifs of the long ā added also in green. Vocalization: large red dots, occasionally also green, blue and yellow dots.

Verse markers: for individual verses – trefoil (type 2.2.3b) with red dots between golden petals, green dot in the center; for groups of five verses – golden letter ﻪ (hā); for groups of ten verses – medallion (type 2.A.II) on the margin, in gold and colors with the inscribed number of verse (سبعون – fol. 3v).
Stitching: thread is preserved in the punctures of the fold.
Traces of old conservation: margins have possibly been cropped.
Defects: upper edges as well as the whole last leaf are slightly mudded; ink peeling off on the flesh side.
Old accession numbers: B. 30 (according to Langlois’ inventory).
Fol. 1r–4v. Surah 38, verses 72(72)-88(88). Incipit: [سويته و]نفخت فيه . Explicit: للعالمين * و[لتعلمن] .
Fol. 5r–5v. Surah 39, verses 2(2)-4(3). Incipit: [فاعبد الله] مخلصاً له . Explicit: في ما هم [فيه] .
Other fragments of the same manuscript: Marcel 51 (NLR), Marcel 102 (fol. 2 and 4) (NLR), also probably Marcel 48(NLR), Marcel 49(NLR) and Arabe 357 (BNF); Gotha 435; Gotha 461."
Olga Yastrebova has translated and sometimes corrected the notes of V. Polosin. Corrected passages are marked with ОЯ (O.Ya).
